text.more:
While Jeb's diary mentions many more people than are included here, only those that have some sort of same-sex attraction are included in the network. Many were one-night stands; they are denoted by the date on which they were mentioned.

Whether these people were gay or bisexual is unknown and it could, in fact, be considered anachronistic to apply modern understandings of sexuality to people living in the early 20th century, who often understood same-sex attraction as a temptation rather than as an inborn trait as we do now. Randall Hare, for example, eventually married a woman, but whether he did this because he was bisexual or because of social pressures that force gay men to enter heterosexual relationships is unknown.
text.intro: Network of gay men and lesbians as described in Jeb and Dash: A Diary of Gay Life, 1918-1945
text.title: Jeb and Dash

legend.colorLabel:
Red - Friend of friend
Orange - Acquaintance
Yellow - Friend
Green - Relationship
Blue - Good Friend
Purple - Jeb Alexander
legend.nodeLabel: Every node is a same-sex attracted person mentioned in Jeb Alexander's diary.
